intro: Hypoestes hildebrandtii, commonly known as the "Hawaiian flame" or "Hawaiian fireplant," is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful bracts that resemble petals. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Hypoestes hildebrandtii thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sun exposure.
